meanings.definition: To act against or provide resistance to something.
meanings.sent1: She opposes the idea of staying up late.
meanings.sent2: The hero opposes the villain's evil plans.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully opposes the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: His determination opposes any obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind opposes the progress of the small boat.

meanings.definition: To be in contrast or conflict with something.
meanings.sent1: His black shirt opposes her white dress.
meanings.sent2: The facts presented oppose the theory proposed.
meanings.sent3: The sweet taste of the cake opposes the bitter coffee.
meanings.sent4: The bright sun opposes the dark storm clouds.
meanings.sent5: His calm demeanor opposes her fiery temper.

meanings.definition: To compete against or be an adversary to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The team opposes their longtime rivals in the final match.
meanings.sent2: She opposes her colleague for the promotion.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel playfully opposes the dog in a race.
meanings.sent4: The young boxer opposes the reigning champion.
meanings.sent5: The student opposes the strict teacher's rules.
